timeline.bodyText: If you define a variable named result, then stop using return statement in the middle of the method body. Please set the value of the variable and return it at the end of the method.
timeline.author: yanghua

replies.bodyText:

timeline.bodyText: For safety, you should judge if the parser is the instance of HoodieDateTimeParserImpl . Although, there is only one implementation currently.
timeline.author: yanghua

replies.bodyText:
For safety, you should judge if the parser is the instance of HoodieDateTimeParserImpl . Although, there is only one implementation currently.

done, I have refactored HoodieDateTimeParser to expose some tool methods.

timeline.bodyText:
I am not sure if it's a good design. You make a detailed implementation pull-up into an abstraction. Why? getInputDateTimeZone and getOutputDateTimeZone  should be abstract method and be pushed down to a sub-class like before. Moreover, you can see it contains if/else block, it is full of changes.
The main benefit of abstract classes is to provide templates for the implementation of some subclasses. Instead of thinking that the default implementation is a template and marking it as an abstract class.
So I think the original design is good. WDYT?
timeline.author: yanghua

replies.bodyText:
I am not sure if it's a good design. You make a detailed implementation pull-up into an abstraction. Why? getInputDateTimeZone and getOutputDateTimeZone  should be abstract method and be pushed down to a sub-class like before. Moreover, you can see it contains if/else block, it is full of changes.
The main benefit of abstract classes is to provide templates for the implementation of some subclasses. Instead of thinking that the default implementation is a template and marking it as an abstract class.
So I think the original design is good. WDYT?

@yanghua thanks for your review. Make it an abstract class can allow us to reuse some tool methods, such as getConfigInputDateFormatDelimiter().
The getInputDateTimeZone and getOutputDateTimeZone has been pushed down to the sub-class now, it is better to be extendable.
please take another look when free, thanks.
replies.author: wangxianghu
